name: Art Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here, and while the room was nice and clean, the management acted like we were imposing on them. Most of the staff was friendly and courteous, but we had some problems, such as the night doorman allowing a very loud group to film in the garage (we called around 2 am and they just got louder revving motorcycles and such), our toilet broke the first night and we were given a plunger to fix it ourselves, and one of the management insisted (very rudely) that we must get our room cleaned every day. Also, they only took cash as payment.
reviews.title: Definitely more apartment than hotel...
Great for Families
reviews.text: My sister and I shared a suite with our 2 little ones, a baby and a 3 year old. This property was perfect for our needs-2 separate bedrooms and 2 separate baths along with a kitchen and a grocery store (so inexpensive!!) right next door. This is not a super fancy place, but a pretty modern, comfortable, convenient space. The service was helpful and friendly especially the bellman/doorman who was very kind and as they say in Argentina "muy amable". The Recoleta neighborhood is lovely for walking and for eating as well as very easy to catch cabs. The rate was a little higher than other places, but this is a full 2 bedroom apartment so it was worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our week in BA. The Artsuites Hotel is well located in the Recoleta District. I think it's the best central location. As others have commented Artsuites is in a residential neighborhood and you get a feel for how the locals live. It's in a very safe part of town.
reviews.title: A Great Place

likes.liked: — The employees were very pleasant and helpful

reviews.text: The ladies that own and manage the hotel are very helpful. They even loaned us an umbrella on a rainy day. They were also very helpful about were to go and what to see. This is the kind of service that you don't often get at a large chain hotel. The concerige, German, is a gem. He spent a lot of time telling us about BA and it's history. He is also very friendly and attentive.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the 8th floor executive suite. We found it clean and spacious. We had a kitchen, large patio and TV in the living room. It's more like an apartment than a hotel. There was very little noise. My only suggestions are that it would have been nice to have some furniture outside on the patio. The bathrooms were functional and clean but lacked character. I read on some reviews that they felt the breakfast was small. We thought it was just right. Toast and medialuna with OJ and tea. Guests have to remember that in many countries like Argentina people don't eat a big breakfast with ham and eggs. We thought the medialunas were yummy and it was nice to get breakfast brought to the room.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

description: ART SUITES & GALLERY, offer business and leisure travelers alike, all the comforts of home in the stylish neighborhood of Recoleta, the residential heart of the City of Buenos Aires. Home away from home + hotel services! Surrounded by trendy shops, museums, bars and restaurants, PLUS AN easy access to the city’s financial district and the bohemian neighborhood of Palermo. Their fully equipped apartments feature spacious interiors, contemporary decor and sun-filled balconies. The recently inaugurated GALLERY SUITES is located only two blocks away from its predecessor, ART SUITES and retains the same high quality standards of hospitality. Additionally, it adds a multi-use venue for art and social events.
